age.description: Used to decide what files to delete when cleaning.

argument.description: The destination path of the symlink if type is `L`.

backup.description:
Create a backup, append a provided string to the filename extension or
a timestamp if value is not a string, only apply if the target file
exists and is modified.

gid.description: File group name or group id.

mount.description: The mount point dir to create on system startup.

mode.description: Mode of the target configuration file

name.description:
The file name, can not be used with target. If only `name` is set, it
writes the content to default configuration directory and creates the
file  as '`name`.conf'.

perm.description: Mount path mode in string format like `"0644"`.

target.description:
File path where to write content to. Defined to
/etc/tmpfiles.d/{config.uid}.conf if uid is defined or
/etc/tmpfiles.d/default.conf.

uid.description: File user name or user id.
